title: Re: Frequent WiFi Disconnects
text:
2 weeks ago
This latest update with the new sounds seems to have majorly broken wifi - my Google Homes are constantly getting disconnected from wifi.
Every other device is completely fine and working great. It would be great if Google could either add a trigger to search for wifi when the "sorry, I can't fine the network" error is triggered, or add a way to reboot the Homes without requiring me to unplug the damned things.
2 weeks ago
After rebooting, they continue to work normally, until at some arbitrary point they feel that the wifi no longer has that.. je ne sais quoi quality, and decided to disconnect from the world like a college student traveling to Europe.

Tuesday - last edited Tuesday
This is not isolated. I have 4 google homes 3 home (living room 3ft from router, bathroom, and bedroom 3 feet from mesh) and a home max in the kitchen. The home 3 feet literally from the router multiple times a day says "I can't find the the wifi network please check your router." The same for the bedroom and bath room homes twice a day. The home max in the kitchen never has a problem and its the furthest away. This just started a few week ago and it's maddening!!! Nothing else has a problem, just Google Homes, Router and Wifi are exactly the same. This is INCREDBILE FRUSTRATING!! It is something Google pushed in its code! The only thing that fixes this is unplugging the Homes and re-plugging them into the electricity.

2 hours ago
How long did the device work before the connectivity situation started? Many many years (5+) for the three Google Homes.
How was the connectivity situation discovered? The 3 Google Home say "I cannot find the Wi-Fi network please check your router."
Did the device give any visible or audible error? See previous answer.
How long did the situation persist before it started to work again? It never resolves itself and after a few hours I unplug the Home and plug it back in again and it works fine immediately after but the problem will come back later in the day.
How many times have you experienced this situation? 3 Google Homes have this issue and they each had it 2 times today so I had this happen 6 times in one day!!! One of them sits three feet from the WiFi & router.
No other Google devices have this problem. I have 2 Nest Cams and a Nest Audio and they never have problems and no other devices have issues either.
